result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam John Staffeldt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Previously posted cash in the amount of $275 applied to total fine and costs leaving a remaining balance of $367 which is to be paid by payment plan at a rate of $25 per month commencing March 1st, 2017 and to be paid on the first of each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam John Staffeldt

Defendant Adam John Staffeldt in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German as a friend of the court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.
Reinstated - same conditions as previously set.

Defendant Adam John Staffeldt via video conference from Ozaukee County Jail with attorney Rachel Marie Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD. Counsel waives reading. Counsel advises defendant thought attorney would appear on behalf. Court reinstates bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
Defendant Adam John Staffeldt not in court. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  State moves for warrant.  Court orders warrant be issued.

Defendant Adam John Staffeldt in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews record.  Defendant indicates they will be represented by the Public Defenders Office.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.
